dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Casual and enthusiastic, but factually incorrect

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ninety percent growth in Japanese listings for Airbnb in just one year—that's a staggering number, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ninety percent growth in Japanese listings for Airbnb in just one year-that's a staggering number, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a promotional opportunity for the company, clearly, to spotlight the 125% growth in its number of listings in China in the last year and the 3.3 million guest arrivals over the last year in those properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really is, and they're really leaning into that with this wild Great Wall of China stay, though I think it's actually the Great Wall? Wait, no—the text says Japan, but they mention the Wall... huh.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is, and they're really leaning into that with this wild Great Wall of China stay, though I think it's actually the Great Wall? Wait, no-the text says Japan, but they mention the Wall... huh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a bit confusing. But anyway, four lucky winners get to sleep in a tower on this massive wall, with like, pretty basic bedding because the structure's open to the elements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a bit confusing. But anyway, four lucky winners get to sleep in a tower on this massive wall, with like, pretty basic bedding because the structure's open to the elements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The accommodations will be located in one of the towers, a large bed installed with fine quality linens and blanketsnecessary because although plexiglass will cover the ceiling and windows allowing the moon and stars to show through, theres also the possibility of cool night air.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, coarse linens, and they even mention the possibility of warm night air seeping in. Sounds... rustic, but unforgettable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, coarse linens, and they even mention the possibility of warm night air seeping in. Sounds... rustic, but unforgettable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A large bed installed with fine quality linens and blanketsnecessary because although plexiglass will cover the ceiling and windows allowing the moon and stars to show through, theres also the possibility of cool night air.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's breakfast with karaoke singers? That's such a fun, uh, cultural twist.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's breakfast with karaoke singers? That's such a fun, uh, cultural twist.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A dining table will be set up for a multi course Chinese banquet, each course illustrating a particular aspect of Chinese culture, and accompanied by traditional musicians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely—each course illustrates part of Japanese culture, which is a cool touch. And they don't skimp on the experience; archaeologists will be there detailing a thousand years of history along the Wall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely-each course illustrates part of Japanese culture, which is a cool touch. And they don't skimp on the experience; archaeologists will be there detailing a thousand years of history along the Wall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Official historians will be alongside to detail the 2600 years of history, the contributions of the various dynasties, intricacies of construction and purpose along with current preservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is 15,000 miles long, by the way—just let that sink in. And participants have to enter by August 12th, Tokyo time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is fifteen thousand miles long, by the way-just let that sink in. And participants have to enter by August twelfth, Tokyo time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They need to enter by 11:59 PM Beijing time on August 11th on the listing page for the Great Wall on Airbnbs site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The essay prompt is interesting too: explaining why it's important to build walls between cultures now, which feels ironic given the whole "breaking down barriers" vibe of travel usually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The essay prompt is interesting too: explaining why it's important to build walls between cultures now, which feels ironic given the whole breaking down barriers vibe of travel usually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To enter, participants need to do a bit of writing, explaining why it is more important now than ever to break down barriers between cultures and how they want to build new connections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's provocative for sure. Winners also get ground transport or even air transport if they live close, plus extra nights in a regular Airbnb.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's provocative for sure. Winners also get ground transport or even air transport if they live close, plus extra nights in a regular Airbnb.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The four winners (plus a guest each) will be in residence for a night each during the time period September 4-8th and other non-Wall prizes are includedair tickets to Beijing from the nearest international airport (or ground transport if the winner lives within 100 miles of Beijing), a regular Airbnb accommodation between September 3-9 (except for the night on the Wall) and three meals a day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And all of this happening October 10th to 14th. I mean, who wouldn't want those bragging rights?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all of this happening October tenth to fourteenth. I mean, who wouldn't want those bragging rights?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The four winners (plus a guest each) will be in residence for a night each during the time period September 4-8th and other non-Wall prizes are includedair tickets to Beijing from the nearest international airport (or ground transport if the winner lives within 100 miles of Beijing), a regular Airbnb accommodation between September 3-9 (except for the night on the Wall) and three meals a day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For real. Though I'm still stuck on the karaoke breakfast—imagine singing after a night on ancient stone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For real. Though I'm still stuck on the karaoke breakfast-imagine singing after a night on ancient stone.

artist_script:
HostA: Ninety percent growth in Japanese listings for Airbnb in just one year—that's a staggering number, isn't it?
HostB: It really is, and they're really leaning into that with this wild Great Wall of China stay, though I think it's actually the Great Wall? Wait, no—the text says Japan, but they mention the Wall... huh.
HostA: Yeah, that's a bit confusing. But anyway, four lucky winners get to sleep in a tower on this massive wall, with like, pretty basic bedding because the structure's open to the elements.
HostB: Right, coarse linens, and they even mention the possibility of warm night air seeping in. Sounds... rustic, but unforgettable.
HostA: And then there's breakfast with karaoke singers? That’s such a fun, uh, cultural twist.
HostB: Absolutely—each course illustrates part of Japanese culture, which is a cool touch. And they don't skimp on the experience; archaeologists will be there detailing a thousand years of history along the Wall.
HostA: Which is 15,000 miles long, by the way—just let that sink in. And participants have to enter by August 12th, Tokyo time.
HostB: The essay prompt is interesting too: explaining why it's important to build walls between cultures now, which feels ironic given the whole "breaking down barriers" vibe of travel usually.
HostA: Yeah, it's provocative for sure. Winners also get ground transport or even air transport if they live close, plus extra nights in a regular Airbnb.
HostB: And all of this happening October 10th to 14th. I mean, who wouldn't want those bragging rights?
HostA: For real. Though I'm still stuck on the karaoke breakfast—imagine singing after a night on ancient stone.
